keyMoments.title: Aisa's Debut in Upper Yard
keyMoments.description: Aisa appears for the first time, gathering soil in Upper Yard. She is shown to possess Mantra (Observation Haki) despite being very young.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the youngest character in One Piece shown to naturally possess Observation Haki, foreshadowing her important role in sensing the battles throughout Skypiea.

abilities.description: Aisa possesses natural Mantra ability, allowing her to sense the presence and life force of others across Upper Yard.

reveals.information: Possesses Mantra (Observation Haki) at a very young age

keyMoments.title: Shura Arrives at Going Merry
keyMoments.description: Priest Shura, riding his giant bird Fuza, arrives at the Going Merry to confront Chopper. He questions why there's only one sacrifice.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Shura as the priest of the Ordeal of String (3% survival rate) and sets up the battle with Chopper and Gan Fall in the next episode.
keyMoments.quote: Why is there only one sacrifice here?

abilities.description: Controls invisible strings throughout his territory with a 3% survival rate.
A lance powered by a Heat Dial that can cut through almost anything.

relationships.description: Serves as one of Enel's four priests in the God's Army.

evolutionMoments.description: Shura arrives to eliminate sacrifices on Enel's behalf.

reveals.information: One of four priests serving Enel, operates the Ordeal of String

keyMoments.title: Mantra Mastery Displayed
keyMoments.description: Satori demonstrates complete mastery of Mantra, predicting and dodging every attack from Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp with ease.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the full extent of Mantra's precognitive abilities in combat, establishing it as a nearly unbeatable power.

keyMoments.title: Impact Dial Attack
keyMoments.description: Satori uses an Impact Dial to deliver a devastating internal attack to Sanji, demonstrating advanced Sky Island technology.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Impact Dials as a powerful weapon that bypasses external defenses.
keyMoments.quote: This is the power of the Impact Dial!

abilities.description: A dial that absorbs impact and releases it in a devastating attack that damages internal organs.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Chopper Encounters Sky Shark
keyMoments.description: While searching for a dropped hammer, Chopper encounters a dangerous sky shark and is thrown back to the Going Merry.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the dangers of the White Sea and isolates Chopper on the ship before Shura's arrival.

keyMoments.title: Finding the Whistle
keyMoments.description: Chopper discovers and recognizes the importance of the whistle Gan Fall gave them, which can summon the Sky Knight.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Chopper's ability to call for help when threatened.

keyMoments.title: Calling for Help
keyMoments.description: Faced with Priest Shura, Chopper desperately blows the whistle to summon Gan Fall, using his last resort to protect the Going Merry.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's resourcefulness and dedication to protecting the crew's ship despite overwhelming fear.

keyMoments.title: Fighting Against Mantra
keyMoments.description: Luffy struggles to land any attacks on Satori due to his Mantra ability predicting every move.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy encountering an enemy whose abilities counter his straightforward fighting style.

keyMoments.title: Hit by Impact Dial
keyMoments.description: Sanji receives a devastating Impact Dial attack from Satori that damages his internal organs.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the dangerous power of Impact Dials and how they bypass Sanji's physical defenses.

keyMoments.title: Fighting Satori
keyMoments.description: Usopp attempts to help fight Satori but struggles against his Mantra ability. He tries to reach the boat with his rope weapon.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's continued efforts despite being outmatched.
